title: With Titan, all that glitters is unfortunately gold
text:
In the past five years, Titan’s reliance on the jewellery business for its top line and bottom line growth has gone up. It now needs a holistic vision on how to improve store openings and keep a steady hand on like-to-like sales growth. But keeping overheads on a tight leash and wooing new customer in a fragmented market can add the much-needed sheen to the business.

A Tanishq store in Kolkata

According to data from Reuters Eikon, target price among analysts tracking Titan has come down from INR1,238 in July to INR1,159 in September. Since June this year, eight ‘buy’ ratings were downgraded to ‘hold’. Titan should look beyond all that glitters, even if its only gold. ( Research support by Rochelle Britto) ( Graphics by Sadhana Saxena) It’s the darling of Nifty50 stock pickers, especially those looking to invest in India’s long-standing consumption dream.
